definition: to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: Ceng Nianan modest recommended Han Jinquan do eldest brother, refuse Han Jinquan efforts.
sentences.chinese: 曾念安謙虛的推薦韓金銓做老大，韓金銓努力推辭。

sentences.english: Now I have one request to make of you. Do not refuse me.
sentences.chinese: 現在我有一件事求你，望你不要推辭。

sentences.english: Mr. Xu tried to courteously reject, but Qing Qing has already put dishes and fruits on the table.
sentences.chinese: 許仙想推辭，卻見青青已經把瓜果菜餚擺上了桌。

sentences.english: Aime jokingly asked if I wanted to go into one of the places, but I declined.
sentences.chinese: 艾梅開玩笑問我想不想進去某個店鋪裏，我推辭了。

sentences.english: Xuxian wanted to refuse but Qingqing had allocated dishes and fruits on the desk swiftly.
sentences.chinese: 許仙想推辭，卻見青青已經把瓜果菜餚擺上了桌。

sentences.english: Since we sent out the invitations we've received seven acceptances and one refusal.
sentences.chinese: 我們發出請帖後，收到的回覆是七位接受，一位推辭。

sentences.english: The night before the wedding, I decided to call my friends and beg off.
sentences.chinese: 在婚禮前的晚上，我決定藉故推辭我朋友的邀請。

sentences.english: He promised to attend but then begged off.
sentences.chinese: 他本來答應出席的，但後來卻推辭了。

sentences.english: Lao Wan doesn't refuse. He quaffs another two cups of liquor.
sentences.chinese: 老萬也不推辭，又連幹了兩杯。

sentences.english: I have one small request to make of you,' she said. 'Do not refuse me.'
sentences.chinese: 拔示巴說，我有一件小事求你，望你不要推辭。
馬德蘭伯伯又推辭了十字勳章。

sentences.english: I think this should be finding a way of saying, no seriously.
sentences.chinese: 我想這應該是推辭的一種說法，就沒當真。

definition: to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
in fear and trepidation (idiom); in reverence before your majesty (court formula of humility)
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to explain/to justify/to defend (a point of view etc)/to provide an explanation/to try to defend oneself
to say goodbye/to take one's leave
to force someone to do something
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
